dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Bootlegger operating on your ISP]
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of
The Planet Policy Enforcement
Sent: Wednesday, April 19, 2006 1:03 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com; kodai_kun@hotmail.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Bootlegger operating on your ISP]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] Bootlegger operating on your ISP
Date: Wed, 19 Apr 2006 17:25:27 +0000
From: Jeff Kleist <kodai_kun@hotmail.com>
To: abuse@theplanet.com


It has come to my attention that one of your clients "SciFiBoxsets.com" is
selling bootleg merchandise. They have a domain registrar that is used to
hide their real ID, that also lists false phone numbers (410 area code
(Baltimore) for a New York business)

CIFIBOXSETS.COM


69.93.90.72
Record Type:   IP Address


OrgName:    ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
OrgID:      TPCM
Address:    1333 North Stemmons Freeway
Address:    Suite 110
City:       Dallas
StateProv:  TX
PostalCode: 75207
Country:    US

ReferralServer: rwhois://rwhois.theplanet.com:4321

NetRange:   69.93.0.0 - 69.93.255.255
CIDR:       69.93.0.0/16
NetName:    NETBLK-THEPLANET-BLK-9
NetHandle:  NET-69-93-0-0-1
Parent:     NET-69-0-0-0-0
NetType:    Direct Allocation
NameServer: NS1.THEPLANET.COM
NameServer: NS2.THEPLANET.COM
Comment:
RegDate:    2003-11-19
Updated:    2004-03-15

They claim that they do not tolerate bootlegs, but sell blatants such as
"Lost Seasons 1 and 2"

http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_id=30
2

Season 2 will not finish airing until May, and the cover art is decidedly
different from the legit Region 3 (mainland asia) version seen here, which
shares the same cover art as the US version and is also more expensive than
the domestic USA release

http://us.yesasia.com/en/prdTransfer.aspx/pid-1004094710/

They also have multiple Star Trek box sets for sale such as this collection
of Deep Space Nine

http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_id=20
1

There is no release in Asia of ANY Star Trek show on DVD except for Japan.
The Japanese sets do notlook like this, and run approximately $150 for each
set, and were limited. The Complete Deep Space Nine will not be released
there until June, and will run $1200 US.

http://www.cdjapan.co.jp/detailview.html?KEY=PPSJ-1033

They also have Voyager, which is oddly labled "Star Trek 3", and features
the Enterprise "E" instead of Voyager on the cover. Something that no studio
would do, or allowed to be done by a licensee (Paramount does not license
Star Trek on video to any external entity)

http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_id=20
3

and here's Enterprise as well, same deals

http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_id=29
6

There's no Chinese release of Stargate either

http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_id=20
4

X-Files has identical box art in Region 3(and all others) to the US

http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_id=20
6

and the legit asian version

http://us.yesasia.com/en/prdTransfer.aspx/pid-1004007165/

And finally, "The Simpsons Complete Seasons 1-16"

The latest Simpsons release is Season 7 across all regions.

You don't have to take my word on these, just call the MPAA 1-800-No-COPYS
or email them http://www.mpaa.org and they will confirm what I've told you.
I hope you kick the bastards off of your servers, and assist the MPAA with
any investigation they might launch. I am in no way affiliated with either
the MPAA or any competition to this website.

My phone # is 610-331-5682






Jeff Kleist
kodai_kun@hotmail.com




- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----

Comment: Using GnuPG with Mozilla - http://enigmail.mozdev.org
